intro: Charieis neesii, commonly known as the Nees's cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent structure. Its flowers are often short-lived but attract various pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
